Authors:
Yan Kang, Yan-Ling Ji, Kun-Ran Zhu, Hui Wang, Hui-Min Miao,
Zhi-Wei Wang
Title:
A new Epichloe species with interspecific hybrid origins from
Poa pratensis ssp. pratensis in Liyang, China
Keywords:
Double alleles of tefA and tubB, endophyte, morphological
characteristics, phylogenetic analysis
Abstract:
We describe a new Epichloë species found in symbiosis with
Poa pratensis ssp. pratensis in Liyang, China. Stromata characteristic
of Epichloë spp. were present on some of the reproductive tillers of
individual host grasses. Only 3 of the 98 stromata observed on field
plants became orange and produced perithecia. Phylogenetic analyses
based on sequences of tubB and tefA indicated that this Epichloë sp. was
an interspecific hybrid related to both E. yangzii and members in the E.
typhina complex clade (ETC). The allele-1 of tefA and tubB grouped in
the E. bromicola/E. yangzii clade; the allele-2 of these two genes
clustered in a distinct sub-clade in the ETC. It is the first report of
an Epichloë species that has interspecific hybrid origins. We propose
the name Epichloë liyangensis Z. Wang, Y. Kang et H. Miao, sp. nov. for
this new species.
